intro: Diplacrum longifolium var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplacrum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. It is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, featuring dry summers and wet winters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
